page.title: 18MISUSE OF SAMPFORD LAND
page.content: This area wherever you stand consists mainly of farmland with woodland dotted here and there. The River Pant meanders through the fields. There is little evidence of inhabitants except for farm houses seen in the distance. Unfortunately, this idylic scene is spoilt from wherever you look. Huge unsightly pylons are placed in the fields. There stark silouhette is seen for miles. Each of these pylons is joined to the next by thick electric wires carrying thousands of volts of electricity across the countryside. Electricity is the main form of power in the Sampfords. Most people use if for heating, lighting and cooking. No gas is piped into the village. If people want to use gas as a service they need to use calor gas. The containers are stored in the gardens.
